en: Dear Future Jerry. It is now two days past the WMD.
zh: 親愛的未來的傑瑞，距離搞砸婚禮已經有兩天了。

en: It’s hard to say exactly when to call your time of death, but the doctor wiped his forearm across his head, shook his head at the nurse, and walked out of the operating room sometime the night before last, knowing there was nothing more that could be done. That was the night you became a monster.
zh: 很難說把什麼時候算作你的死亡時間，但前天晚上某個時候，醫生用手揩拭了額頭，衝著護士搖了搖頭，走出手術室，於是他明白，已經徹底無計可施了。

en: The Jerry you used to be, the Jerry I used to be, he’s gone.
zh: 你曾經是傑瑞，我也曾經是傑瑞，後來他死了。

en: All that’s left is this sick, twisted fuck who later today is going to blow his sick, twisted-fuck brains all over the wall.
zh: 剩下的只是那個病入膏肓、心理扭曲的雜種。今天晚些時候，他會抓著這副身軀的腦袋撞牆。

en: Damn you, Doctor Goodstory for not being able to fix me.
zh: 該死的古德斯特里醫生，你沒有治好我。

en: Damn you, Past Jerry, for letting go, for giving up, for allowing yourself to become this way.
zh: 該死的曾經的傑瑞，因為你的放縱、你的放棄，讓自己變成現在這個樣子。

en: It was your job! Your goddamn job to save us!
zh: 這是你的使命，你的使命就是拯救我們！

en: Where was the fight?
zh: 戰鬥在哪裡？

en: Past Jerry from day one and day four and five, you got yourself into this mess.
zh: 過去的傑瑞從第一天開始，到第四天，再到第五天，你讓自己陷入這混亂的境地。

en: You could have done it, you know. You could have done the world and that poor young girl a favor and put that gun into your mouth back when Doctor Goodstory gave you the news.
zh: 你知道你能辦到的，你可以幫這個世界、這個可憐的女孩一個忙，當古德斯特里醫生把消息告訴你時，你明明就可以把槍放到嘴裏。

en: People say suicide is a selfish act. They say it’s cowardly.
zh: 人們常說，自殺是一種自私的行為，他們會說你懦弱。

en: People say these things because they don’t understand.
zh: 不過人們之所以會這樣說，恰巧是因為他們不理解。

en: It’s actually the opposite. It’s not cowardly, in fact it takes incredible courage. To stare Death in the face and tell him you’re ready .
zh: 剛好相反，自殺的人並不懦弱，他需要十分強大的勇氣來直面生死的考問。

en: Some will say escaping that is where the selfishness comes in, but that’s not true.
zh: 有些人會說逃避責任就是自私，但事實並非如此。

en: Your death right now is like pulling off a Band-Aid—quick pain for your family that will fade.
zh: 現在，你的死亡就像揭開一塊創可貼，對你的家人而言，這是短暫的痛楚，很快就會逝去。

en: You owe them at least that.
zh: 至少，這是你欠他們的。

en: Where to begin.
zh: 從哪裡開始呢？

en: The speech (two million hits now) and then the knife, and you and Sandra fought about that knife.
zh: 那段視頻（現在點擊量已經達到兩百萬了），還有刀，你和桑德拉因那把刀發生過爭吵。

en: You convinced her not to go to the police because, after all, what had you done?
zh: 你說服她不要去報警，你做過什麼呢？

en: Perhaps nothing. Perhaps you had found it. Or stabbed a giant rat—and the world wouldn’t miss a giant rat now, would it?
zh: 也許什麼都沒有做，也許你是在哪兒撿的，也許你殺死了一隻碩鼠，不會有人放過一隻碩鼠的，不是嗎？

en: After finding the knife, you and Sandra spent most of the afternoon watching the news.
zh: 發現刀后，你和桑德拉下午大部分時間都在看新聞。

en: You said very little to each other.
zh: 你們彼此很少說話。

en: You just watched the news and waited for the call. You didn’t know who the call would come from, just that it would.
zh: 你剛才看了新聞，等著電話，你知道有人會打來，但不知道誰會打來。

en: Mrs. Smith was still alive, because Sandra had found an excuse to go over and check on her, and it wasn’t anybody from the wedding party, but that still left nearly four hundred thousand other people in the city.
zh: 史密斯太太還活著，桑德拉找了一個借口過去看過她；也不是參加婚宴的任何人。但這個城市裡還有將近四十萬人。

en: The call didn’t come.
zh: 還是沒有人打電話過來。

en: Heard what? Sandra asked.
zh: 她問你們是否聽說了，「聽說什麼？」

en: Heard about Belinda, Eva said.
zh: 桑德拉問。「聽說貝琳達的事。」伊娃說。

en: What about Belinda?, Sandra asked, though no doubt her mind was a little train, chugging its way through different scenarios, pulling into the My husband killed her station, and yes, that’s exactly where she disembarked.
zh: 「貝琳達怎麼了？」桑德拉問。但毫無疑問，她的腦海中有一列小火車，正轟隆隆地駛過不同的疑慮，最終停在了「我丈夫殺害了她」的那一站，她在那兒下了車。

en: Belinda was dead. Somebody had stabbed her to death in her own home.
zh: 是的，貝琳達死了，有人在她家裡捅死了她。

en: Eva was crying on the phone, and Sandra was too, and even you cried, J-Man.
zh: 伊娃在電話的那頭哭了，桑德拉也哭了。你也哭了，傑瑞。

en: You cried for Belinda, you cried for Sandra and Eva, and you cried for Past Jerry and for yourself.
zh: 你為貝琳達而哭，你為桑德拉和伊娃而哭，你為曾經的傑瑞而哭，也為自己而哭。

en: Who would do this? Eva’s voice was coming through the phone, saying these things over and over.
zh: 電話里傳來伊娃的聲音，她一遍又一遍地說。

en: Sandra just kept saying she didn’t know, she didn’t know, but she did know.
zh: 桑德拉只是在不停地說她不知道，她不知道，但其實她知道了。

en: Her skin had gone so white she looked as though she had been stored in the fridge for the last two months.
zh: 她臉色變得無比蒼白，彷彿在過去的兩個月里一直被保存在冰箱里。

en: They spoke for ten minutes. You sat in the dining room while Sandra sat at the kitchen bar, her back to you for most of the call, and you watched the clock.
zh: 他們說了十分鐘，你坐在餐廳里，而桑德拉坐在廚房的灶台旁。

en: It was ticking away the amount of time Belinda had been dead. It was ticking away the final moments of your life too.
zh: 她打電話時，一直背對著你，你看著時鐘嘀嘀嗒嗒地走著，貝琳達人生的最後時刻已經消逝，你人生的最後時刻也已經消逝。

en: You knew it then, just as you’d suspected it the night before—you knew if you had hurt somebody, you would pay the ultimate price.
zh: 你心裏很清楚，即便前天夜裡你還十分懷疑，那就是如果你傷害了別人，你會為此付出最大的代價。

en: You clock-watched while your mind constructed the final scenario. You would use the gun. It would be quick.
zh: 你注視著時鐘，頭腦中構建著最後一個場景：你會用槍，這樣最快。

en: What do we do now?
zh: 「我們現在該怎麼辦？」

en: They were her words, her back still to you.
zh: 是她在說話，可她還是背對著你。

en: She was like cracked glass, one slight knock and she would shatter.
zh: 她像塊布滿裂痕的玻璃，輕微一碰，就會立即粉碎。

en: I didn’t kill her, you said.
zh: 「我沒有殺她。」你說，「我沒有。」

en: And . . . oh my god, she said, and she spun the bar stool so she could face you, and you knew what was coming—it was another piece of the puzzle slotting into place. That day she brought you back home, she went to her house first! You knew where she lived!
zh: 她說著旋轉了一下板凳，這樣她就可以面對你了，你知道接下來會發生什麼，就像一塊拼圖放對了位置，「那天她帶你回家，她順便回了趟家，所以你知道她住在哪裡！」

en: Sandra— Don’t, she said, and put her hand up in a stopping gesture.
zh: 「桑德拉——」「不要說話！」她用手做出一個閉嘴的手勢，「沒有什麼好說的，傑瑞，沒有。」

en: She stormed out of the room. You didn’t call after her. You couldn’t.
zh: 她衝出房間，你沒有叫住她，你也做不到。

en: What could you have said?
zh: 你能說什麼呢？

en: Even now she’s upstairs either having just called the police, or still building up the nerve to do so.
zh: 即使現在她在樓上，剛剛報了警，或者正在鼓足勇氣打算報警，你又能說什麼呢？

en: Future Jerry, you feel like a character in one of your books.
zh: 未來的傑瑞，你就像是書中虛構的角色。

en: You’ve done this. You own this.
zh: 你已經做到了，你自己也承認。

en: So this is it. You’ve still got two suicide notes to write, one to Eva and one to Sandra.
zh: 就是這樣，你還有兩份遺書要寫，一份給伊娃，一份給桑德拉。

en: This journal will end up being nothing but the ramblings of a madman. Soon to be a dead man.
zh: 日記最終會被認為是一個瘋子的胡言亂語，你很快就會成為一個死人了。

en: Sandra will have to face the horror of running downstairs and discovering you, but at this stage it seems she’ll see that more as a relief than anything.
zh: 桑德拉會下樓看到你，然後一臉恐懼，但隨後她會覺得是種解脫。

en: Good-bye, Future Jerry.
zh: 再見了，未來的傑瑞。

en: If there’s another life waiting for you, hopefully you can do better in the rewrite.
zh: 如果還有另一種生活在等待著你，希望你能將它重寫得更好。

en: The garage door closes behind them. They both stay sitting in the car in the dark.
zh: 車庫門在他們身後關閉了，他們兩人都在黑暗之中。

en: “Last year you told me you were starting to talk to yourself,” Hans says.
zh: 「去年你告訴我，你開始自言自語了。」漢斯說，「你會跟亨利·卡特對話。

en: Do you still do that?”
zh: 你現在還會這樣做嗎？」

en: A year ago that would have embarrassed him. Now it’s just an everyday thing.
zh: 一年前這還會讓他不好意思，現在，這已經是家常便飯了。

en: “Sometimes. Why?”
zh: 「有時會，怎麼了？」

en: “Henry is the one with all the big ideas, right?
zh: 「亨利思路很開闊，對不對？

en: “He’s just a name, it’s like I put my author hat on when I go to work, but it’s still me who comes up with the ideas.
zh: 傑瑞說，「他只是一個名字，就像我工作時戴著的作家帽子，但仍然是我來構思的。

en: Henry isn’t a different personality,” he says, but sometimes he isn’t so sure.
zh: 亨利並不是我另一個不同的人格。」他說，但有時他並不那麼肯定。

en: Henry has been helping him today, and aren’t there times he suspects that Henry is just another name for Captain A?
zh: 亨利直到今天都在幫助他，他有時會懷疑，亨利只是「阿爾茨船長」的另一個名字。

en: “So put your author hat on now,” Hans says, “because that’s what we’re doing.
zh: 「那麼，現在你就戴上作家帽子吧。」漢斯說，「因為這正是我們正在做的事情，我們有活兒要幹了。」

en: “Work?”
zh: 「什麼活兒？」

en: “I need to know if it’s possible.”
zh: 「我想知道是不是真的有可能。」

en: “If what’s possible?”
zh: 「什麼是不是真的有可能？」

en: Hans opens his car door. The interior light comes on.
zh: 漢斯打開車門，車內燈亮了起來。

en: Jerry can see tools hanging on the walls, some gardening equipment, some rope and a shovel and rolls of duct tape that are the go-to tools of Henry’s trade.
zh: 傑瑞可以看到牆上掛著各種工具，諸如園藝設備、繩子、鏟子、成卷的膠帶，這是亨利幹活時的首選工具。

en: “I want you to think like an author while I pitch you this idea.
zh: 「當我向你說明我的想法時，我希望你像一個作家那樣思考。

en: Can you do that?” Hans asks.
zh: 你能做到嗎？」漢斯問。

en: “I can try.”
zh: 「我可以試試。」

en: “You need to do more than try,” Hans says.
zh: 「你不只是要試試。」漢斯說，「好嗎？」

en: “Okay.”
zh: 「好的。」

en: “Good.
zh: 「好的。

en: So this is a story about a crime writer who’s in a nursing home. He has dementia. He keeps confessing to crimes he thinks he did, but he didn’t do them, he just wrote about them.
zh: 那麼，現在這個故事講述的是一個住在療養院里的犯罪小說家，他患有老年痴呆症，他不斷承認自己犯下的罪行，但他根本沒有犯過罪，他只是寫了這些罪行而已。

en: There are crimes he has done— for example he shot his wife and he killed a girl just after his daughter was married, and there’s a chance he killed another girl when he was young, so he’s not an innocent person, but he doesn’t deserve to be punished for crimes he hasn’t committed.
zh: 但是，他的確有犯罪行為。比如他開槍打死了他的妻子，他在女兒結婚後殺死了一個女孩，還有就是，他很有可能在年輕時殺害過另外一個女孩，所以他不是一個清白的人，可是，他又不應該因他沒有犯下的罪行遭受額外的懲罰。

en: Today he wakes up in the middle of a crime scene, and he has no memory of how he got there or what he’s done.”
zh: 今天，他在犯罪現場醒來，他不知道他是如何到達那裡的，也不知道他都做了什麼。」

en: “Is there a point to this recap?” Jerry asks.
zh: 「這種複述有意義嗎？」傑瑞問。

en: “The entire time he questions why he can remember some things but not others.
zh: 「整段時間他一直捫心自問，為什麼有的事情他記得，而有的事情他不記得。

en: The Alzheimer’s, of course, hides things from him.
zh: 當然，阿爾茨海默病掩蓋了部分記憶。

en: And he’s repressed painful things from his past.
zh: 而且，他因過去痛苦的事情而倍感壓抑。

en: But he can’t remember walking into town, can’t remember these women, can’t remember any of it.
zh: 但是，他不記得步行進城，不記得這些女人，任何事情都不記得。

en: He finds that he’s been drugged, and recently too.
zh: 最近，他發現自己還被下了葯。

en: Nobody has ever figured out how he escapes from the nursing home, or how he makes his way into town.”
zh: 沒有人能想象得出他是怎樣從療養院溜出來的，還有他是怎麼進城的。」

en: Hans pauses and stares at him. “Come on, Jerry, keep thinking of it as a novel.”
zh: 漢斯停頓下來，凝視著他，「好啦，傑瑞，像構思小說一樣好好想想吧。」

en: “But it’s not a novel.”
zh: 「但是，你說的不是小說。」

en: “Get Henry to think of it.
zh: 「讓亨利去想。

en: Goddamn it, Jerry, work with me here.
zh: 媽的，傑瑞，配合我的工作。

en: Close your eyes and pretend you’re back in your office and you’ve got your author hat on, and you’re letting Henry do all the work.
zh: 閉上眼睛，假設你回到寫作房，戴上作家帽子，讓亨利去構思所有情節。

en: You and Henry are writing your next big seller.”
zh: 你和亨利正在寫下一本暢銷書。」

en: Jerry closes his eyes. He thinks about his office.
zh: 傑瑞閉上了眼睛，想象著自己回到寫作房。

en: He can remember the smell of the room, can feel the desk beneath his fingers, the jade plant on his desk he bought ten years ago that was still on that desk when he was there yesterday.
zh: 他能記住房間的氣味，能感受到手指下的辦公桌，他十年前買來的玉制盆景依舊擺在辦公桌上，彷彿他昨天還在那裡。

en: He can remember the way the sun fell into the room, the angle fractionally different every day, the way it would hit and fade the framed
zh: 他還記得陽光射進房間，每時每刻的角度都會略微不同。

en: King Kong Escapes poster on the wall. Only he wouldn’t see it fade, it faded the same way you don’t notice a child growing every day, but you know it’s happening.
zh: 還記得掛在牆壁上鑲框的《金剛的逆襲》海報，他不會看到它在褪色，因為這就好像你注意不到自己的孩子每天都在長高一樣，但你知道它的確正在發生。

en: In King Kong Escapes, King Kong was pitted against his exact robot duplicate, a battle of the titans, and boy how he loved those B movie posters from half a century ago and how much Sandra hated them, how she wouldn’t let him hang them anywhere else in the house.
zh: 在影片《金剛的逆襲》中，金剛與他的複製機器人對決。他還記得自己有多麼喜歡這張半個世紀前的B級電影的海報，記得桑德拉有多麼討厭它，他把它掛在哪兒她都不準。

en: He would sit in his office and he would use Henry Cutter as an alias, but he didn’t think he was Henry Cutter.
zh: 他想象著自己坐在寫作房裡，用亨利·卡特作為筆名，但他並不認為自己是亨利·卡特。

en: He was Jerry Grey, the author, whose exact author duplicate built a life on creating fiction.
zh: 他是傑瑞·格雷，是一名作家，亨利·卡特則是他自己的複製品，創作著小說作品。

en: He wrote during the day, and at night he watched stories other people created for TV.
zh: 他白天寫作，晚上看電視，看別人是怎麼創作故事的。

en: He would read books by other writers, go to movies.
zh: 他還會閱讀其他作家的作品，觀賞電影。

en: Fiction was his life.
zh: 小說就是他的生命。

en: Henry Cutter was only a name and, like earlier today, he needs Henry’s help.
zh: 亨利·卡特只是一個名字。但像今天早些時候一樣，他還需要亨利的幫助。

en: “Are you thinking of this as a novel?”
zh: 「你是不是把這當成了小說？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: “Everything I just told you, if it were a book, what would be happening?”
zh: 「如果這真是發生在書里，接下來會發生什麼？」

en: “Why would somebody do that?” Hans asks.
zh: 「為什麼會有人這樣做？」漢斯問。

en: Jerry pictures it. He bounces some ideas back and forth with Henry, and then they settle on one. “He’s being snuck into town on the days of the murders. Snuck into town and dumped somewhere.
zh: 傑瑞想象著，他和亨利交換著想法，最後鎖定在某種動機上：「他在發生謀殺案的日子里被弄進城，悄悄進城，然後被丟棄在某個地方。

en: He’s not dumped at the first crime scene, because then whoever is doing this can’t kill any more women without the perfect scapegoat, because he knows the writer will be caught.
zh: 不過，他並沒有被丟棄在兇案現場，因為兇手覺得要殺掉更多的女人必然離不開一隻完美的替罪羊，他知道犯罪作家就是最好的替罪羊。

en: He also knows he can’t keep doing it forever.
zh: 他還知道，他不可能永遠這樣做的。

en: He figures he can kill four women. The first three, he dumps the writer at random locations, but on the fourth he leaves him inside the house to wake up and get his prints and DNA all over the place, which is what happens, and the writer thinks he’s done it.”
zh: 他覺得他可以殺死四個女人，前三次，他隨便把作家丟棄在某個地方，但在第四次，他把他丟到一幢房子里，到處留下他的指紋和DNA，這就是真相，所以作家以為是他做的。」

en: Instead Hans asks, “So who’s the killer?”
zh: 他看看漢斯，等著他發笑，但漢斯沒有笑，相反他問道：「那麼兇手是誰呢？」

en: “Isn’t that obvious?”
zh: 「這不明擺著的嗎？」

en: “Indulge me.”
zh: 「告訴我。」

en: “Somebody who has access to the nursing home and to the drugs to sedate the patients. Somebody who knows the writer is confessing to crimes. Somebody who hides jewelry in the writer’s pockets so the writer will think he took them.”
zh: 「他能進入療養院給病人下藥，知道作家一直坦承著虛構的罪行，能把首飾揣到作家的口袋裡，讓作家以為是他拿的。」

en: “Somebody from the home,” Hans says.
zh: 「那個人就在療養院。」漢斯說。

en: Jerry nods. “Sometimes people say my books are implausible. I remember that.”
zh: 傑瑞點點頭說：「有時候人們說我的書太虛假了，我記得的。」

en: Hans shrugs. “Most crime novels are.
zh: 漢斯聳聳肩說：「大多數犯罪小說是這樣的。

en: People don’t want to read about real life.”
zh: 可是人們又不希望讀到有關現實生活的事。」

en: “This is real life.”
zh: 「可這就是現實生活。」

en: Do you remember what Eva told me earlier on the phone?”
zh: 你還記得伊娃先前給我打電話時說的話嗎？」

en: “She said one of the orderlies said I’d confessed to him last night that I’d killed somebody.”
zh: 「她說，一個療養院的護理員說我昨晚向他坦白我殺了人。」

en: “Fiona Clark,” Hans says. “If somebody is sneaking you out, don’t you think it’s the same person who says you confessed?”
zh: 「傑瑞，」漢斯說，「如果真有人偷偷把你弄出來，你覺得會是說你坦白殺人的那個人嗎？」

en: “Unless I did confess,” Jerry says.
zh: 「除非我真的坦白了。」傑瑞說，「我會坦白是因為我做了，要麼就是我把新聞里發生的誤當成我做的。」

en: “I could have confessed because I did it, or I confessed because I saw it in the news and thought I did it.” “In these books of yours,” Hans says, “what would be the next step? What would a person in your situation do?”
zh: 「那麼在你的書中，」漢斯說，「接下來會發生什麼呢？

en: “Go to the police.”
zh: 「會去報警。」

en: “No he wouldn’t,” Hans says.
zh: 「不，他不會的。」漢斯說。

en: He wouldn’t, Henry says.
zh: 「他不會的。」亨利說，「好啦，說實話。」

en: “They should, but they never do, because if they did then that would be the end of the story, right?
zh: 漢斯說，「他們應該報警的，但他們從未報警。因為一旦他們報了警，那麼故事就該結束了，對不對？

en: It would be wrapped up by chapter three.
zh: 早在第三章這本書就該結束了。

en: And anyway, the police would never believe this story.
zh: 不管怎麼樣，警方絕不會相信這個故事的。

en: Somebody has been drugging you, Jerry, and I just don’t see you walking twenty miles, and I don’t see the police worrying about the fact that there are no witnesses who saw you walking all that way.
zh: 傑瑞，有人給你下藥了，我才不相信你會步行三十公里，我也不相信有警察會相信這樣的說辭。而且你一路走過去，連個目擊證人都沒有。

en: Think about it.”
zh: 好好想想吧。」

en: Jerry thinks about it.
zh: 傑瑞陷入沉思。

en: Both him and Henry. Then they carry on. “In a book the next step would be for the writer to go and see the orderly he confessed to.
zh: 他和亨利繼續著：「在書中，下一步應該是作家去看看那個他曾坦白罪行的護理員。

en: Jerry remembers something else then. “The same orderly who wants to be a writer.”
zh: 這是傑瑞可以記得的，「而且，那個護理員希望成為作家。」

en: “Write what you know,” Hans says.
zh: 「寫下你知道的。」

en: “How about we reverse that? How about we do what you write and go and pay this guy a visit.”
zh: 漢斯說，「不如我們就這樣去做，按照你寫的去拜訪那個人怎麼樣？」

en: “His name is Eric,” Jerry says, “and he might be innocent.”
zh: 「他的名字是艾瑞克，」傑瑞說，「他可能是無辜的。」

en: “That’s what we’ll figure out.”
zh: 「這就是我們需要弄清楚的。」

en: Before they can start to figure it out, a car pulls into the driveway on the other side of the garage door.
zh: 還沒等他們反應過來，一輛車已經駛進車道，停在車庫門的另一側。

en: A moment later two doors are opened and closed.
zh: 片刻之後，傳來兩扇門打開和關上的聲音。

en: There are footsteps, and then knocking on the door.
zh: 有腳步聲，接著是敲門聲。

en: If this were a book, Jerry thinks, then this would be the police arriving ahead of schedule.
zh: 如果這是一本書，傑瑞心想，那麼，很有可能是警察提前到達了。
